text: The following code raises a TypeError :

code:
>>> class X:
...   def a(self):
...     print "a"
...
>>> class Y(X):
...   def a(self):
...     super(Y,self).a()
...     print "b"
...
>>> c = Y()
>>> c.a()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "", line 1, in 
  File "", line 3, in a
TypeError: super() argument 1 must be type, not classobj

text: If , however I replace class X with class X(object) , the same code will work .
I am using python 2.5.2 .What's the explanation for this ?
